result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Emma Guthrie

9:09 AM Defendant Jose R Martinez in court.  Attorney Emma Guthre in court for Jose R Martinez.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
New attorney asks for some time to get up to speed.
Defense has received discovery and an offer.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:41 AM Defendant Jose R Martinez in court with attorney Conner Helvig on behalf of Gregory W Isaac.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Niki Kane, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Isaac has left the firm. 
Defense requests time to have counsel reassigned and get up to speed.

  Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on August 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:22 AM Defendant Jose R Martinez in court with attorney Gregory W Isaac who appeared by Zoom.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court notes that the the prelim waiver previously filed was not filed out correctly.
Attorney Isaac states he filed an amended prelim waiver form.
The Court pulls through.
The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
AMENDED - Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Hearing on June 20, 2022 at 09:15 am.

09:50 AM Defendant Jose R Martinez appeared by Zoom with attorney Gregory W Isaac who appeared by Zoom.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim A appeared by Zoom with Victim/Witness Specialist Melanie Pence. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court finds that the prelim waiver was not filled out correctly and the Defendant is having Zoom trouble. 
Victim A presents a statement and requests to have contact with the Defendant.
The Court notes that the wishes of the victim needs to be done in writing and heard before the Court. 
The Court will adjourn the matter. 
THE COURT ORDERS THE PARTIES TO APPEAR IN PERSON.
PRELIM WAIVER FILED ON MAY 31, 2022.  Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Filed by Atty Greg Isaac

Request for zoom link
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 05-25-2022. Granted.
Preliminary hearing on June 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witnesses A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  The Defendant can have contact with victim A though Our Family Wizard for the sole purpose of the minor child(ren).

09:01 AM Defendant Jose R Martinez in court with attorney Gregory W Isaac.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.
